Namespace: p5

p5

Source:

Methods

createCanvas(width, height) → {Graphics}

Patched version of createCanvas use createCanvas(100, 100, SVG) to create SVG canvas. Creates a SVG element in the document, and sets its width and height in pixels. This method should be called only once at the start of setup.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
width Number Width (in px) for SVG Element
height Number Height (in px) for SVG Element
Source:
  • rendering.js, line 67
Returns:
Type
Graphics

loadGraphics(graphics, successCallbackopt, failureCallbackopt)

Due to a known issue (image is not surely ready before onload fires), we have no way to draw SVG element synchronously. So, this method will load a SVG Graphics and then convert it to Canvas Graphics asynchronously
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
graphics p5.Graphics the p5.Grphaics object
successCallback function <optional>
 Function to be called once the SVG Graphics is loaded. Will be passed the p5.Graphics.
failureCallback function <optional>
 called with event error.
Source:
  • rendering.js, line 24
See:
  • https://github.com/zenozeng/p5.js-svg/issues/78
Example
pg = createGraphics(100, 100, SVG);
background(200);
pg.background(100);
pg.ellipse(pg.width/2, pg.height/2, 50, 50);
loadGraphics(pg, function(pgCanvas) {
     image(pgCanvas, 50, 50);
     image(pgCanvas, 0, 0, 50, 50);
});

loadSVG() → {p5.SVGElement}

loadSVG (like loadImage, but will return SVGElement)

querySVG(selector) → {Array.<SVGElement>}

Returns an Array of SVGElements of current SVG Graphics matching given selector
Parameters:
Name Type Description
selector String CSS selector for query
Source:
  • element.js, line 2
Returns:
Type
Array.<SVGElement>

registerSVGFilter(name, filterFunction)

Register a custom SVG Filter
Parameters:
Name Type Description
name String Name for Custom SVG filter
filterFunction function filterFunction(inGraphicsName, resultGraphicsName, value) should return SVGElement or Array of SVGElement.
Source:
  • filters.js, line 8
Example
registerSVGFilter('myblur', function(inGraphicsName, resultGraphicsName, value) {
    return SVGElement.create('feGaussianBlur', {
        stdDeviation: val,
        in: inGraphics,
        result: resultGraphics,
        'color-interpolation-filters': 'sRGB'
    });
});
filter('myblur', 5);

saveFrames(filename, extension, duration, fps, callback)

Extends p5's saveFrames with SVG support
Parameters:
Name Type Description
filename String filename
extension String Extension: 'svg' or 'jpg' or 'jpeg' or 'png'
duration Number duration
fps Number fps
callback function callback
Source:
  • io.js, line 119

saveSVG(svgopt, filenameopt, extensionopt)

Save the current SVG as an image. In Safari, will open the image in the window and the user must provide their own filename on save-as. Other browsers will either save the file immediately, or prompt the user with a dialogue window.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
svg Graphics | Element | SVGElement <optional>
 Source to save
filename String <optional>
extension String <optional>
 Extension: 'svg' or 'jpg' or 'jpeg' or 'png'
Source:
  • io.js, line 71
